msbt.message: I don't get how something so small got to be such a great hunter.
If I had horns like thatI'd never get through my front door.
With that kind of beak, it's a wonder there's any fish left in the ocean!
But how did it scratch its back, I wonder. Those arms are mighty short.
Just thinkin' of carrying all them plates and spikes and so on makes my back hurt.
Why's this fella gotta be so dang tall My neck hurts just craning to see its head!
If I'd had tusks like that, my neck would STILL be sore, even after all these millions of years.
That ain't just some kind of oldfangled shrimp, right?
So you're tellin' me this fella came all the way up from the water just to become a rock? Pfft!
That fish looks almost as scary as I do!
Now that there is one giant head.
I guess the museum'll take anything these days.
Something that small had to have a lot of gumption to survive with all them dinosaurs about.
So, you're the reason we've got this fine specimen, eh? That's downright benevolent of you!
Y'know, I do believe I recognize a few of these folks from back in the day! Gahaha!
